main

Class Blinker

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Blinker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Blinker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Blinker class is responsible for controlling System Tray Icon. It changes System Tray Icon according to the usage.
    Author:
    vliopard

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Blinker(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<FileQueue> fileQueue, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.lang.Integer> signalQueue, java.awt.TrayIcon iconTray)
      Blinker Constructor - Initialize a Blinker object for controlling System Tray Icon.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void changeSystemTrayIcon(int iconIndex)
      This method changes System Tray's Icon based on Settings.iconList[] items.
      private void changeSystemTrayTip(long totalItems)
      This method updates System Tray's Tool Tip message with the count number or remaining items to process.
      private static void err(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      This method displays an error message through the embedded log system.
      private static void msg(java.lang.String message)
      This method displays a message through the embedded log system.
      void run()
      This is the run method of the Blinker thread, that will monitor icon changes and exit when receiving stop signal from main thread.
      private void setColor()
      This method set that the color icon is displayed and keep it until another icon is requested.
      private void setGray()
      This method set that the gray icon is displayed and keep it until another icon is requested.
      private void setGreen()
      This method set that the green icon is displayed and keep it until another icon is requested.
      private void setRed()
      This method set that the red icon is displayed and keep it until another icon is requested.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Blinker

        Blinker(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<FileQueue> fileQueue,
       java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.lang.Integer> signalQueue,
       java.awt.TrayIcon iconTray)
        Blinker Constructor - Initialize a Blinker object for controlling System Tray Icon.
        Parameters:
        fileQueue - This is to inform Blinker thread on how many items are in the processed list, for displaying the proper icon.
        signalQueue - This is a queue for controlling when Blinker thread is going to be terminated.
        iconTray - Icon object that receives new icon image for changing.

      • run

        public void run()
        This is the run method of the Blinker thread, that will monitor icon changes and exit when receiving stop signal from main thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • changeSystemTrayTip

        private void changeSystemTrayTip(long totalItems)
        This method updates System Tray's Tool Tip message with the count number or remaining items to process.
        Parameters:
        totalItems - The total items in the queue to be processed.

      • changeSystemTrayIcon

        private void changeSystemTrayIcon(int iconIndex)
        This method changes System Tray's Icon based on Settings.iconList[] items.
        Parameters:
        iconIndex - The index number of Settings.iconList[] to be displayed on System Tray.

      • msg

        private static void msg(java.lang.String message)
        This method displays a message through the embedded log system.
        Parameters:
        message - A String containing the message to display.

        private static void err(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        This method displays an error message through the embedded log system.

        errorMessage - A String containing the error message to display.
